LETTERS OF OBSCURE MEN

counsel. Down on your marrow-bones, and pray with- out ceasing for eight days, and invoke, fasting, St. Helena who recovered the true eross. In like manner may I recover that letter. Then once more will you abide in security.

Lo, all these things have I done out of brotherly love toward you—for we are brothers all. Farewell.

From Heidelberg ,· at the house of the Lame Man at Leipsic, who heedeth not though a man's nose be shut in the postem. Would that you were with him. You would have no need of spectacles, for ’tis said he supplieth them without charge.
